decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with spells and then bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard to deal damage to the opponent. The deck focuses on casting cheap spells to trigger the Phoenix's ability and control the board with removal spells like Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse. The deck also includes card draw spells like Treasure Cruise and Consider to maintain card advantage. Overall, the goal is to be aggressive, control the board, and utilize the graveyard to bring back Arclight Phoenix for repeated damage.

The deck focuses on using Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to create a powerful combo that overwhelms the opponent. By controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, while also utilizing cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker for advantage, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces and win the game quickly. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruption, the deck can both apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan, showcasing its versatility and power in a competitive setting.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and deal fast damage to the opponent. It uses a combination of cheap spells, card draw, and flashback spells to power out the Phoenixes and create a fast aggro strategy. The inclusion of Tempo Trespass allows for extra turns to continue pressuring the opponent. The deck also includes countermagic and disruption to protect the aggressive game plan and control the board. The overall goal is to overwhelm the opponent with Phoenixes and burn spells for a swift victory.

The essence of this red aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and burn spells. By continuously applying pressure with low-cost creatures like Manifold Mouse and Soul-Scar Mage, backed up by removal spells like Lightning Strike and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to finish the game swiftly. The inclusion of cards like Monstrous Rage and Burst Lightning further enhances the deck's aggression, while also providing reach to close out games. The deck also utilizes utility lands like Ramunap Ruins and Mutavault to maximize its damage output and maintain board presence.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive play by utilizing efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful threats like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to pressure the opponent and close out the game quickly. With a mix of creatures, removal, and disruption spells, this deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent while disrupting their strategy, leading to quick victories. The inclusion of cards like Mutavault and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker add versatility and flexibility to the deck's game plan.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on fast-paced aggression, utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Bloodtithe Harvester to disrupt the opponent's strategy and take control of the game. It also includes powerful creatures like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to pressure the opponent and close out the game quickly. The deck is designed to maintain consistent pressure on the opponent while utilizing disruptive spells to stay ahead in the game.

Utilizing a combination of powerful creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to apply constant pressure to opponents while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures such as Bloodtithe Harvester and Blade of the Oni, while also leveraging powerful spells like Fatal Push and Kolaghan's Command to control the board. The deck aims to maintain a high level of aggression and disruption throughout the game to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to get a fast start with aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Manifold Mouse, Heartfire Hero, and Kumano Faces Kakkazan provide early pressure, while Reckless Rage and Soul-Scar Mage help remove opposing threats. Shadowspear and Monstrous Rage help push damage through, while Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike serve as direct damage spells. The inclusion of Mutavault and Ramunap Ruins offer additional reach in the late game, making it difficult for opponents to stabilize. Overall, this deck aims to push tempo and overwhelm opponents before they can establish a strong defense.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Greasefang and Parhelion II to generate a powerful flying army and overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes various pieces to support the combo, removal spells to control the board, and disruption to protect the combo from being disrupted by the opponent. The goal is to efficiently set up the combo pieces and quickly close out the game before the opponent can adequately respond.

The deck focuses on assembling the Greasefang Parhelion combo as quickly as possible through a combination of creature protection, removal spells, and land support. By utilizing cards like Cryptcaller Chariot and Guardian of New Benalia, the deck aims to protect key combo pieces like Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II while setting up the win condition. The inclusion of Monument to Endurance and Fatal Push helps to control the board and maintain the combo's viability. Ultimately, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combo finish.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay using low-cost creatures and direct damage spells to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. The main strategy is to efficiently deal damage early in the game, utilizing cards like Burst Lightning, Lightning Strike, and Reckless Rage to control the board and maintain pressure. Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins provide supplemental damage sources, while Shadowspear and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance offer additional utility. With a focus on fast-paced aggression, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents before they can establish their own game plan.

This Pioneer 1 vs 1 deck focuses on using the Combo-Retraction Helix strategy to control the board and maintain tempo. With cards like Vivi Ornitier and Cori-Steel Cutter, it aims to generate value and disrupt opponent's plays. Utilizing cards like Torch the Tower and Stormchaser's Talent, it aims to push damage through and finish the game quickly. The deck includes various card draw and mana ramp options, such as Mox Amber and Consider, to ensure consistency and smooth gameplay. The inclusion of key lands like Steam Vents and Riverpyre Verge further enhances the deck's flexibility and overall strength.

The main focus of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of flying threats and token generation. By using cards like Bishop of Wings, Righteous Valkyrie, and Resplendent Angel, the deck aims to gain life and put pressure on the opponent. Collected Company allows for fast creature deployment, while Skyclave Apparition helps to deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic helps to ramp up the mana curve and ensure a fast start.

This aggressive Red Deck Wins Pioneer deck focuses on quick and efficient damage output through a combination of powerful creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent by consistently attacking with creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Kumano Faces Kakkazan while finishing off the opponent with direct damage spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage. The deck also utilizes utility lands like Mutavault and Ramunap Ruins to provide additional reach and versatility in combat.

The main idea of this Mono White Control deck is to use a variety of control spells and enchantments to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up a strong board presence. Cards like Day of Judgment and Seal from Existence provide removal options, while Authority of the Consuls and Elspeth, Storm Slayer help control the battlefield. The deck also includes cards like The Birth of Meletis and Caretaker's Talent to generate value over time. With the addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent in a longer game.

The main idea of this Red Deck Wins Pioneer 1 vs 1 Aggro deck is to overwhelm opponents with fast, aggressive creatures like Screaming Nemesis, Heartfire Hero, and Kumano Faces Kakkazan. Supporting cards like Burst Lightning, Reckless Rage, and Lightning Strike provide additional damage and removal options. Mutavault and Ramunap Ruins offer extra utility while cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Bonecrusher Giant help deal with opposing threats. The goal is to apply pressure early and consistently to secure a quick victory.
